FileHdr.FileNotes: NOTE: May want to add key for account name for later
Budgets and Comparatives
Account Batch Transactions.
Note: May want to add system code, so the transaction can be tracked back to the originating system.
Account transaction distribution

FILE DESCRIPTION:
This file is used for Tour order/Voucher control and A/P detail. (A tour order should become the basis of an A/P detail)
FIELD DESCRIPTION:
AP_ENTRY_TYPE - Type of entry: 15 - FIN_EST - Finalization estimate 14 - DEP_EST - Departure estimate 13 - INVOICE - Invoice 12 - CR_INV - Credit Invoice 11 - CR_MEMO - Credit memo 10 - PP_REQ - Prepayment Request 9 - BROKER - Broker payment header (Pyts slctd, not yet paid) 8 - PRPYMT - Prepayment 7 - DR_MEMO - Debit memo 6 - PD_INV - Fully paid Invoice 5 - PD_CINV - Fully paid Cr-Invoice 4 - PD_CRMM - Fully paid Credit Memo 3 - DIST_PP - Fully Distributed Prepayment 2 - DIST_DR - Fully Distributed Debit Memo 1 - PD_BROK - Paid Broker payment
AP_V_BASED_BK - Hotel/Land detail is contained in this booking(0=manual) AP_V_BASED_PAX - This Pax detail (0 = Booking detail) AP_V_BASED_SEQ - Hotel seq for hotel, -1 for land AP_V_BASED_MOD - Last voucher printed based on this bk mod (nxt mod)
BK_V_DATE - Date voucher printed (0 = Not printed yet) AP_ACK_DATE - Date this finalization estimate must be acknowledged by.
BK_GL_ACTION_DATE - Doc control/GL ctl-Date the posting/ack should occur AP_GL_STATUS - G/L or Vchr stat - What type of U/D needs to be done next 0 UD_DONE - All updates done! (ie., Cancel before vouchers out) 1 NO_VCHR - No Status (If SEND TO? = "No") 2 REQ_VCHR - Request Voucher be printed (Voucher printed next run) 3 ACK_VCHR - Voucher Printed, Wait for Acknowledgment (After prtd) 4 REC_ACK - Acknowledgment Received (Voucher Confirmed) 5 VCHR_PRTD - Voucher Printed (No Ack Requested) (After printed)
6 CXL_REQ - Cancellation Voucher Requested (Xl Vchr prtd on next) 7 ACK_CXL - Waiting for Cancellation Acknowledgement 8 REC_ACK - Cancellation Acknowledgement Received 9 CXL_PRTD - Cancellation Voucher Printed 10 REQ_REPRT - Request the voucher be re-printed (Set if orig. already printed) 11 MAN_FINL - Manually entered finalization estimate 12 DEP_TYPE - Departure estimate update --> 12 (BK_TOUR)(BK_TOUR)Cost of Tours Sold 100.00 (AP_DEP_EST_USD->GL) (CNTRL->AP_EST_GL)Uninvoiced Tour Cost 100.00 13 IN_TYPE - Invoice update --> 16 (INV_ENT)(AP_EST_GL)Uninvoiced Tour Cost 100.00 (AP_DEP_EST_GL) (CNTRL->OVER_UNDER)Over/Under estimate 1.00 (CNTRL->AP_ACCT)Accounts Payable 101.00 (INV_AMT->GL) 14 CM_TYPE - Credit Memo update --> 16 (INV_ENT)(AP_EST_GL)Printing Expense?? 200.00 (AP_DEP_EST_USD->GL) (CNTL->AP_ACCT)Accounts Payable 200.00 (INV_AMT->GL) 15 PU_TYPE - Prepayment Paid Update --> (CK_DATE)(CNTL->AP_ACCT)Prepayment 150.00 (INV_AMT->INV_GL) (AP_HIST>AD_ACCT)Cash 150.00 (HIST_AMT 16 DM_TYPE - Debit Memo update --> (CK_DATE)(CNTL->AP_ACCT)Prepayment 170.00 (INV_AMT->INV_GL) Advertising expense 170.00 17 PA_TYPE - Payment Applied Update --> 6 or 0 (if bal = 0) (CK_DATE->PYMT_DATE)(AP_ACCT)Accounts Payable 100.00 (INV_GL) (CNTL->GAIN_LOSS)Gain/Loss on curr. 10.00 (->GAIN/LOSS G/L) (AP_HIST>AD_ACCT)Cash 110.00 (AP_HIST_AMT)
Note: No G/L entries are required for broker payments, as long as the cash account numbers are transfered to the invoices at the time of payment.
NOTE: GET RID OF AP_OPEN_VENDOR IN KEY #6

The A/R open item file is not used until the booking is accepted by the customer. Acceptance is defined as changing the booking status to "OK" or receiving the first payment.
AR_DOC_TYPE: I - Initial Invoice Charge (+) P - Payment (always -) M - MCO payment (-) C - Credit (-) D - Debit (+) R - Refund to customer (+) (If departure date is -1, hold the refund) A - Adjustment to invoice (+/-) (Changes in the tour Price (+/-)) (Cancellation Charges (+)) (Type "A" is always automatic)
AR_POSTED: G/L Posting status 0 - Not posted yet ACTION DATE is the transaction date 1 - Request refund (also not posted yet) ACTION DATE is the trx date 2 - Post the Departure update (Type "I & A" only) ACTION DATE is the departure date 3 - Posted, no more action is required ACTION DATE is the transaction date
G/L Notes:
Be careful...This is complicated.
The A/R G/L accounts come from this file. They don't come from the booking file because A/R detail can also accept payments for non-tour amounts which could never be traced back to a booking, but the amount can be traced back to an A/R detail (booking number = 0). This guarantees an accurate audit-trail from the amount in the G/L.
Every A/R transaction either Debits or Credits the A/R account on the transaction date. (Of course, reducing or increasing the amount owed)
AR_TRX_DATE - Transaction date = Transaction posting date AR_DEPARTURE - Departure date of this booking (do not set!) AR_ACCT is the Accounts Receivable account. If the amount is positive, the amount is a Debit on the booking date, negative is credit. AR_ACCT_BK is the counter - A/R account posted on the booking date. AR_ACCT_DR is the counter - BK account posted on the departure date. (Type I & A only) AR_ACTION - Next trx or departure date
Warning: These account numbers are supplied by the A/R G/L posting program at posting time. Do not supply an account number unless you want to override the information in the booking's tour header.

Might want to enter date/time for transaction number for non checks.
Types: C - Checks D - Deposit

The booking status is as follows: OK - OK booking - Pax have accepted, money request(ed) XL - Booking canceled RQ - Awaiting Confirmation of services (tour has same status) (When status is changed to OK a confirmation is rqstd.)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Notes:
The comments and remarks are in the booking comment detail file
This is how the "modifications" work:
Whenever the user enters the booking system by entering this booking number, the modification number is incremented (Note: the master record is NOT copied to a modification unless a change is made. If a change is made, the current (last modified) record is written with the next modification number and the "Modified by" field is updated to the CURRENT booking agents name.)
Whenever any of the booking detail files are modified (ie., Passenger detail, Line Item detail, or Comments/Remarks) the system copies ALL of the current records to the next modification number before allowing changes to the current items.
Whenever any of the tour detail files are modified (ie., Hotel, Tour, and Air detail files) the system copies the detail record to the current modification (0) and sets the modification number in the booking record (last four fields) to the current modification number. If no modifications are made--ie., additions--then the system assumes that the information is just added to the information in the master file.
This is how the programming should be done:
For the booking record, after the user is done, the current version of the booking should be moved to a temporary area. Then the original version should be read and compared. If there are any changed (including Hotel, Tour, Air) fields, then the old version should be deleted and then written to the next mod. number. Then the new booking info. (in the temp. area) should be moved to the booking record and written to modification number 0.
All this should be done in the initial program.
For the booking detail files (pax,line) it's easy. First (only for the line file) scan the appropriate file and the selected Opt/Alts. Then display the current detail records. If the user selects a item to change, then copy ALL the current line items to the NEXT_MOD number before allowing any changes. Make sure you change a field in the booking record so the booking record will be copied to match these detail.
For the Tour/Booking detail files it's a little more complicated. First, scan and Tour Header detail and write the booking detail. Then scan the Opt/Alt detail and write, rewrite, or delete the original to come up with a valid detail. (Remember: these detail files NEVER exist for tours; only for tour headers and Alt/Opt. This means that the modifications for a Scheduled Tour will always exist and an Alt selected on that particular departure date.
Next, display the current detail and allow the user to make any changes.
If any changes are made, then update the Hotel/Tour/Trans/Air field in the booking record to the NEXT_MOD. This indicates when the detail was changed from the original form. This also insures the booking will be modified. If no changes are made (or the user types DEL) then the mod field is changed to -1 and all the detail fields are deleted.
NOTE: Remember that the XXX mod field is initialized at -1. The first step is done ONLY if the mod field is -1.
The tour file has only one version, because none of the information can be altered by the user. Everything is updated by system operations.
Remember: the mod number is always (-1) for tour and tour header detail.
Also see Tour file entry for a description of what to do if something changes. --- For example, if an air segment was changed from one carrier to another, you might want to alert all the agents who use that air. For the bookings where you didn't make any changes to the air, it's easy. Just go the the booking option: Reprint Confirmation (modifying any field-- such as adding a remark like Please note air changes will do the same thing). If you have already modified the air then you will have to go to the air screen in the booking and either make the changes, or type DEL (and probally make some changes anyway). A new confirmation will automatically print out.
For hotels and tours it gets a little more difficult. Especially if tour orders have already been sent. For example, a hotel burns down, so the hotel has to be changed. If no modifications have been made to the booking record, then everything is automatic. The system attempts to create a new A/P estimate for each item. If one exists already, then the amount and the number of services are check to make sure they are the same. If not, then the acknowledgment date is updated, a tour order is created (with the word **modified**) and the mod number is added to the A/P estimate (even if no changes). Any new services are treated as new. After all the tour orders have been modified, then the current A/P estimates are scanned to make sure all the mod numbers are correct. These A/P estimates are cancelled and a cancellation voucher is automatically created. (Cancellation vouchers should be acknowledged, even though they can never become Invoices)
For bookings with tour,air or hotel changes, a duplicate confirmation is not automatically created. To have the system print a duplicate confirmation, just add a remark to the remark file telling the agent what was changed.
When an audit trail is tracked for a booking, finding changes to the detail file is easy (Of course changes to the booking file are easier). If the mod field matches the NEXT_MOD field for tour detail files, then you know that the previous mod was changed to get this one. If the CNGD field is "Y" for a booking detail file then you know the previous mod has the previous data.
Remember, for a first-time booking the NEXT_MOD number is 0. All current logic will create the correct files with this MOD.

FILE DESCRIPTION:
This is the control file for the booking system.
CHANGES:
Add: Use: Mail/Fax/cable/Telex Cut off days to use: Telex/Fax (This info might be added to the vendor file)

The field HDET_VOUCHER is not really required. It is only there to speed up the voucher revising program (BK_V_HOTEL). Instead of having to read through all the A/P detail to see if an A/P detail exists for this land, all you have to do is read the A/P detail.
Next time, add a local room and meal cost field: Then make the USD fields Non-existent in the record. This makes the A/P estimate program much easier!

The "Manual" field is here if the booking is modified. If it is modified, everything but the manual fields will be deleted (mod) and the new line items will be added.
The BK_LINE_PAY_AT is used to figure the Deposit and Final pay amts for manually entered fields: (F)inal payment date (D)eposit due date (A)gent item (not included in A/P)
FULLY_COMMABLE is only for manually entered fields.

The rooming code is coded as follows: 0 - Twin or triple extra passenger (must be in sequence) 1 - Single passenger (If share seq = 0, single) (If share seq = -1, then this pax requests a share) (still charged single supplement) (If a match is found, change type to 2 and enter then sharing booking/seq number) 2 - Twin passenger (if the Share seq # = 0 then the next passenger will be a 0 (If the share seq = -1 then this pax will be paired with another twin) (If the share ^= 0 then this pax is paired w/bk/seq) 3 - Triple passenger
Need to add more types for operations: - Twin/Double - Child share - Other pax types (non-skiers)
Cash Batch Header Record
Cash batch detail
All Product Detail

Later, information should be added to this file so that periodic payments of employee taxes can be made automatically. The checks could automatically be queued to the A/P system to be printed payable to the proper payee.
Add: Federal Payment A/P Vendor Code: I 6 State FICA SDI FUTA SUI
Note: This information does NOT change from year-to-year. This is the hotel information header.

FileHdr.FileDesc: Hotel list for the Product Display

FileHdr.FileNotes:
FILE DESCRIPTION:
This file holds the pricing information of the hotel file.
The USE_RATE_TYPE and USE_CLASS fields are used when a rate type doesn't apply. For example, for rate type "B" (Blocked room), the USE rate type would probally by "F"/"R" (FIT/Run of the house). Or "F"/"S" (FIT - Standard room) might go to "F"/"R".
This file is used for; Tours, Hotels, Land, Transportation, and Air.

FileHdr.FileDesc: Land List for the Product Display

FileHdr.FileNotes:
The MCO status codes are as follows:
1 - Entered 2 - Posted 3 - Submitted 4 - Paid 5 - Variance posted to G/L
Need to write program to Post variance between anount applied to A/R and the amount collected by the carrier.
The field AR_MCO_GL_ACCT is used for two different purposes: - On MCO entry, this field holds the A/R account for the booking to transfer it to A/R open on MCO posting - On MCO submission to carriers, this account is updated with the MCO receivable account, so when the actual amount is received the variance can be properly distributed.

FIELD DESCRIPTIONS:
AP_HIST_TYPE - Type of payment A - Check B - Broker draft D - Debit Memo P - Prepayment
Remember: The USD equivalent amount of the check comes from the Asset system; The system automatically recalls the FIFO inventory and figures out the weighted exchange rate to be used to calculate the Gain/Loss on currency changes.
AP_HIST_APPL_USD - ACTUAL US Dollars used in this payment AP_HIST_APPL_GL - Amount this payment reduced the AP_VEN_INV_USD (Amount applied * Departure exchange rate) (DO NOT get rid of this field, it IS required because of rounding on payments. ie., a dep est of HKD300 is estimated at USD100. three payments of HKD100 would be re-created at reductions of USD33.33 each)
This file should also have the codes, amounts, (and G/L numbers) of any special deductions, so when a check is voided, the G/L entry can be reversed and the YTD, etc. amounts can be adjusted down.

Note: The key ends in a sequence number rather than the time because the next sequential flight may not be in order because of the international date line.
This can be fixed by reading the GMT offset from the city file.

There can be more than one TK_HEADER for a booking. A different ticket for each passenger. The TK_ALT_SEQ number is used for the passenger seq. no. The TK_ANSW_SEQ field is reserved for multiple tickets for one passenger.
NOTE: !!!! : This file is currently at the maximum number of characters, ie., 511. To use the fare const. fields, move to and from temporary fields.
TK_UD_STATUS - U/D status of Ticket
NO_TK_STAT - No Status REQ_TK - Request a ticket (At the booking ticket update date, all tickets are automatically updated to this status!!!) AUTO_TK - Print a computer generated ticket now! WAIT_TK - Ticket in system (CRS) waiting for OK TICK_TK - Ticketed!!! G/L updates may be done now (Updated when ticket gets a number and a issue date) ALL_TK - All updates done (Issue, ARC, and Departure) need O/R OVER_TK - All Updates done!!! XL_TK - Cancel this ticket XLD_TK - Ticket cancelled
These status values apply to pax mod records only, for headers, the only valid values are NO_TK_STATUS, REQ_TK, and AUTO_TK.
This arrangement is still efficient, because the Issue, ARC, and Departure dates are usually close together, so sequential reads through the file will not be that slow.
For: Ticket info. entry: If Issue date or Ticket number entered, update status = TICK_TK
Internal Tickets: Read through all where status=AUTO_TK, Ticket no="b", and ticket by "I" Update Ticket no, Date issued on, Status = TICK_TK
ARC Authorization: Read through all tickets where Status = TICK_TK and Issue date in range Update ARC U/D date = date
Departure Update: Read through all tickets where Status = TICK_TK and Departure in range Update Departure U/D = date
Issue G/L Update: Status = TICK_TK, Issue date in range Update Issue date = date
Override update: Read through all where status = TICK_TK or ALL_TK and Override received Update Override received = date

On the next revision add: PR_CHECK_DATE - Actual Date of the check (Usually no per. end) WEEKS_WORKED - Calculate the weeks worked for state report
Several other files should be set up to tie in with this one.
PR_DEPT_DIST - For department/gl distribution in time entry PR_JOB_DIST - For job distribution
PR_GL_DIST - File to send the G/L postings to. Key: G/L NUMBER,PAY PD END DATE G/L NUMBER PAY PD END DATE TRANSACTION AMOUNT +/-
Need a simple way to allow the user the option of automatically sending regulay, overtime, vacation, holiday, sick, special 1 & 2, other pay, taxes, deductions, and net pay to the correct G/L accounts.
Maybe a G/L number for all of these should be set up in the department file--If not, the department file should be deleted, it serves no purpose!

FILE DESCRIPTION:
Every tour has an entry here. The tour file is the basis for everything having to do with the tour side of the booking (Vouchers, A/P control, etc...)
NOTES: TOUR_STATUS - The tour status is as follows: OK - OK tour (Services can be arranged or confirmed) GB - Group Blocked CL - Tour closed to more bookings (type G only) XL - Tour canceled RQ - Non OK status NS - No status (No operations will be done on this tour) TOUR_DEP_DATE - The departure date of the tour (Date the A/P and A/R systems are updated) TOUR_FINALIZED - Date the tour is finalized (On the finalization date, the A/P estimates are created) (This is usually the date tour orders are printed) TOUR_FINAL_DOC - Date to send the final documents (to the pax) TOUR_TICKETS - Date to write/request the tickets ACTION_TYPE - This type matches the DOC_PRINT_ON field in the BK_TOUR_DOC file.
CHANGES: Change HDR Wait to an I/2 field: default to the actual number of acknowledgement days.

The tour header file is used for different purposes. It all depends what kind of tour it is used with.
Scheduled tours - The Tour Header file is not automatically copied over into a booking version when a tour is booked, like all the other tour types.
Scheduled Tour Master - This file contains the general information about a tour series. The departure date is not entered here, and any information which the user wants entered for the individual departures may be indicated here.
Unscheduled Tours - The tour master doesn't have a departure date, so the information entered here is copied over for each booking. The sales for these tours may be controlled through a tour inventory record or the inventory assigned to hotels or air used on the tour.
Tour Master - All the tour information except the departure date is stored here.
Modular Tours - Modules are set up in module building, then the detail information is copied to the booking detail when the modules are added.
Modular Tour Header - This header(s) has all of the header information for a standard modular tour.
Modular Tour Component Header - This contains the information to be used with each module. Not much of the header information is used, but the detail information is very important. (Tour Component Header)
The detail information is copied to the booking detail with a notation of the module header that it came from. The module header is not copied.
FITs - These tours do not use headers; The information comes straight from the Hotel and Tour data.
FIT Tour Header - This header(s) has all of the standard information used for FIT tour building.
FIT Module Component Header - This header is used to package frequently used tour sequences. For example, this header could contain the hotels and tours for a standard three days in Tokyo. This is different from the modules above in that the detail is immediately copied to the booking detail, where the above tours remain as a package.
FIELD DESCRIPTIONS: HDR_FINALIZE - Days prior to the departure date to finalize the tour. (0 means finalize on the booking date) HDR_FINAL_DOCS - Days prior to departure to send final documents (0 means no final documents) HDR_SP1_DAYS - Days before departure date to print all special 1 documents (ie., maybe tour recaps) HDR_SP2_DAYS - Another days field

FileHdr.FileDesc: Special memory-based record used for cal
Tour list for the Product Display

FileHdr.FileNotes:
FILE DESCRIPTION:
This file is used to store the pricing for all types of tours. It also stores the Changes to the header pricing for all alternates and optionals.
NOTES:
For header pricing, the PRICE_MOD_CODE should always be (R)eplace. This way, the sequence number when the line-items are written will be correct.
The PRICE_SEQ number must be unique within a Header or ALT/OPT. This will insure that the sequence number in the line items will be unique if a modification to the Header is encountered and the header line item has to be deleted.

It would be nice to add this stuff later: Send Mail Via: Telex/Phone/Mail Our Customer number in their computer: EFT Account number Computer Mail Phone Number: Need Social Security Number for 1099 printing

FileHdr.FileDesc: The virtual table that maps to a table
FileHdr.FileNotes: Since this is a mapped table, you will have to supply a file name.
